metadata.title: Scalable Architectures and Data Management in Internet of Things Systems

abstract.text: The Internet of Things (IoT) connects physical devices through sensors, networks, and cloud platforms. This paper explores scalable IoT architectures, focusing on data collection, processing, and real-time analytics.

body_text.text: IoT systems consist of sensing devices, communication protocols, and backend services. Efficient data management is required due to the high volume and velocity of sensor-generated data.
We analyze edge computing and cloud-based processing models to reduce latency and improve scalability in large IoT deployments.
Results show that edge-based preprocessing significantly reduces network load while maintaining system responsiveness.
